On Wed, 2002-08-21 at 15:18, Vladimir Bossicard wrote:

    > everyone was testing their code multiple times a day and builds were a 
    > daily occurrence, but some of us are in traditional with the "fragile" 
    > way of doing things and are doing the best we can ;-)
    
    so fix it! :-)  Set up a dedicated build server and install a tool to check out
    your code every day from CVS, compile it, execute the tests and report the
    errors (like continuous integration on SF).
    

I was thinking of saying something along those lines, but "change your
organization or change your organization" is harder to swallow in the
current tech economy.

In reference to a continuous integration tool, check out CruiseControl
on sourceforge: http://sourceforge.net/projects/cruisecontrol/

Dave
